Assistive technologies are being transformed with the advent of emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, Brain-machine interfaces and advanced manufacturing.

Depending on the case, both low-tech and novel technologies will coexist among available options. Focus on user needs, inclusivity and responsible innovation will be crucial to identify appropriate solutions for each of us.

The technology trends report developed by the World Intellectual Property Organization â€“ WIPO presents a great assessment of the current state of the art and the challenges ahead. The launch of this report will be marked by a panel where I will share the work done with IEEE Standards Association and CLAIRE on responsible, human-centered research and innovation

Join us at the launch of the second issue of the WIPO Technology Trends on Assistive Technology on March 23, 2021 from at 14:00 CET. Link for webcasting: https://lnkd.in/gaS2bWY

Invitation code: BP754DWS99

#assistivetechnology #innovation #artificialintelligence #neurotechnologies #responsibleinnovation #inclusivedesign #techforgood #ai4good #standards

Global Trends in Assistive Technology (AT): Launch of the Second Issue of the WIPO Technology Trends Report (WITT)

The report -complemented by infographics and dashboard for conventional and emerging (e.g., AI-powered) ATs- is now accessible in the following link: http://www.wipo.int/tech_trends/en/assistive_technology
